stories.title: Simh is not longer a FOSS project · Issue #1163 · simh/simh

stories.text:
As Elon Musk has duly pointed out there are issues with censorship and manipulation at twitter:

https://twitter.com/elonmusk/status/1525612988115320838?s=20&t=6_KScJ9C4UP4B8iLAoc2rQ

These issues obviously affect other systems: https://twitter.com/Kinnardian/status/1526081603901874176?s=20&t=6_KScJ9C4UP4B8iLAoc2rQ

Have these issues come up with Hacker News? If so what so and how so?

Do you have a plan for addressing censorship resistance on HN?
stories.title: Ask HN: Ask dg what is your plan for censorship resistance on Hacker News?
California sets nation's strictest rules on recycling labels
Show HN: DataStation – App to easily query, script, and visualize data

stories.text:
Background: I'm an older, self-taught developer who was a team parent for my kid's sports team. I wanted to embed our Teamsnap ICal calendar in our team's Squarespace website only to find out that its kind of a pain in the ass. Yes, you can use Google Calendar or to do it but the design looks about 15 years old.

So, a couple Fridays ago with a bottle of wine and some open source help from ICal.Net & FullCalendar.io, I got something working. Spent the last few weeks cleaning it up and adding in a subscription component. Hoping to break even on hosting.

I know this is a niche thing that I pretty much built to scratch my own itch. I anticipate tens (if not DOZENS!) of other potential users are out there...but, what the heck...you are supposed to "Just Ship It", right?? (https://kitze.io/posts/saddest-just-ship-it-story-ever)

So here you go HN...let me know what you think but go easy on me ;-)
stories.title: Show HN: Embed Customized ICal Calendars on Your Website

Japanese weather satellite accidentally watched Betelgeuse go dim
